pageContext.description:
An incomplete copper alloy tanged dagger or knife blade of late Bronze Age date (1150-800 BC). The object is composed of a single cast piece with a slight central ridge. The shaft is rectangular with a single, central, circular perforation at its upper end. A minor amount of the shaft is missing due to an old break. The blade is wider below the shaft to form angular shoulders which then taper to a point at its lower end.



The metal is a dark green with lighter green patches and has a pitted and corroded patina.



Similar examples can be seen on the Portable Antiquities Database: Unique ID: BERK-302CB3, Unique ID: DOR-FAC625 and Unique ID: LIN-01C457
